title: Design and Utilization of Adaptive Educational Hypermedia Systems Based on Learning Styles

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Strengthening pre- and in-service teachers' capacity to design and operate adaptive learning systems accessible via smartphones.

learning_goals: Learners can classify learner characteristics with 80% accuracy using a learning style diagnostic tool.
Learners can explain and apply five or more principles of adaptive hypermedia system design.

Learners can propose three or more content structure designs applying microlearning (5-minute units) and gamification elements to improve science learning outcomes in mobile environments (smartphones/tablets) and achieve an 80% or higher suitability score through peer and instructor feedback.

Learners can design a protocol to improve the accuracy of a system personalization algorithm by 15% by analyzing formative assessment data (minimum 500 cases) within six months and submit a report demonstrating over 80% achievement in three key metrics (accuracy, processing speed, user satisfaction) via peer review and experimental validation.
Learners can validate the educational effectiveness of a learning style-based Adaptive Educational Hypermedia System (AEHS) using pre-post comparative research methods.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
